pages.text: Different $(item)Ropes$() that can be used in a $(thing)Grappling Hook$().$(br)Ropes have multiple stats:$(li)Maximum Distance: How far away a hook can be in blocks$(li)Hook Gravity Multiplier: How much the rope affects the hook gravity.$(li)Launch Force Multiplier: How much the rope affects the launch force.$(li)Winch Force Multiplier: How much the rope affects the possible winch force$()
$(o)basic, simple, light and rather flimsy$()$(br)Max Distance: 16$(br)Hook Gravity Multiplier: 1.0x$(br)Launch Force Multiplier: 1.0x$(br)Winch Force Multiplier: 0.8x
$(o)sturdy and heavy$()$(br)Max Distance: 32$(br)Hook Gravity Multiplier: 1.2x$(br)Launch Force Multiplier: 0.6x$(br)Winch Force Multiplier: 1.2x

The $(item)Ender Rope$() can extend very far and attaches instantaneously to the targeted block. If no block is targeted launching the hook will fail. Inertia still applies.$(br)Max Distance: 256$(br)Hook Gravity Multiplier: 0.2x$(br)Launch Force Multiplier: 0.1x$(br)Winch Force Multiplier: 1.0x
